titocc.compiler.elements

Class Declarator

  • java.lang.Object
    • titocc.compiler.elements.CodeElement
      • titocc.compiler.elements.Declarator

  • public abstract class Declarator
extends CodeElement
    Identifier that is modified with arbitrary pointer/array declarators. Note that the declarators are parsed in the reverse order. I.e. the innermost declarator becomes the outermost modifier to the type: ((*a)[2])[3] is identifier "a" that is pointer to a 2-sized array of 3-sized arrays.

    EBNF definition:
    DECLARATOR = "*" DECLARATOR | DIRECT_DECLARATOR
    DIRECT_DECLARATOR = IDENTIFIER | "(" DECLARATOR ")" | DIRECT_DECLARATOR "[" EXPRESSION "]"

      Constructs a Declarator.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the variable name for this declarator.
        Returns:
        the variable name

      • getModifiedType

        public abstract CType getModifiedType(CType type)
                               throws SyntaxException
        Modifies the type with this declarator and all its sub declarators. For example given type "int", two nested 2-sized array declarators would return int[2][2].
        Parameters:
        type - type to be modified
        Returns:
        modified type
        Throws:
        SyntaxException

      • parse

        public static Declarator parse(TokenStream tokens)
        Attempts to parse a declarator from token stream. If parsing fails the stream is reset to its initial position.
        Parameters:
        tokens - source token stream
        Returns:
        Declarator object or null if tokens don't form a valid declarator
